abstract: After three years in second place, General Motors reclaimed its title due to strong sales in every region of the globe. The automaker surpassed Volkswagen as Toyota fell to third.
snippet: After three years in second place, General Motors reclaimed its title due to strong sales in every region of the globe. The automaker surpassed Volkswagen as Toyota fell to third.
lead_paragraph: DETROIT — After three years of settling for second place, General Motors reclaimed its title as the world’s largest automaker in 2011, a year when its sales grew in every region of the globe while Toyota sales were hampered by major natural disasters.

headline.main: G.M. Regains the Top Spot in Global Automaking
headline.print_headline: G.M. Regains The Top Spot In Global Automaking
